## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```

## Creating folders and loading data

```{r}
raw_dir <- "data/_raw/"
data_file <- "gravier.RData"
data_loc <- "https://github.com/ramhiser/datamicroarray/raw/master/data/"

if( !dir.exists("data") ){
  dir.create(path = "data")
}
if( !dir.exists(raw_dir) ){
  dir.create(path = raw_dir)
}
if( !file.exists(str_c(raw_dir, data_file)) ){
  download.file(
    url = str_c(data_loc, data_file),
    destfile = str_c(raw_dir, data_file))
}
load(file = str_c(raw_dir, data_file))
```

## Cleaning and augmenting data

```{r}
gravier_clean <- gravier |>
  bind_cols() |> 
  as_tibble()

```

We now change the poor to 1 and good to 0, as well as rename y and

```{r}
gravier_clean_aug <- gravier_clean |>
  mutate(y = case_when(y == "poor" ~ 1,
                       y == "good" ~ 0)) |> 
  relocate(early_metastasis = y)
```
